issues.detail: Predicate 'NessoCausale' declared with arity 2 expecting (Inadempimento, Danno) but used in rules with atomic arguments (Inadempimento, DannoEconomico) and (Inadempimento, DannoEconomico) - arity mismatch
Predicate 'Inadempimento' declared with arity 2 expecting (Debitore, Contratto) but axiom uses (Professionista, Inadempimento) where Inadempimento should be a Contratto type, creating type confusion
Axiom a1 uses predicate 'Imputabilita' with formula that doesn't match its ontology definition - should relate Debitore to Inadempimento event, not create a new predicate instance
Rule r2 concludes (Inadempimento Professionista ContrattoServizi) while rule r1 already assumes (Inadempimento Professionista ContrattoServizi) in its conditions, creating logical redundancy

Query uses atomic predicate (ResponsabilitaContrattuale Professionista Cliente DannoEconomico) but arguments don't match expected arity 3 signature (Debitore, Creditore, Danno) - should be consistent types

auto_fix_suggestions: Fix NessoCausale arity usage to match its 2-argument declaration or adjust declaration to match usage pattern
Correct Inadempimento argument usage in axiom to maintain proper type consistency
Redesign axiom a1 to properly establish Imputabilita without creating predicate instances
Remove redundant Inadempimento assumptions to eliminate logical loops
Ensure query arguments match declared predicate arity patterns
